entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 3:21PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WATER ALONG THE BALDWIN PENINSULA TUESDAY MORNING INTO WEDNESDAY... A strong weather front will move north into Kotzebue Sound by Monday afternoon, bringing strong southeast winds 30 to 40 mph that will cause water levels to rise 3 to 4 feet above normal high tide line by Tuesday morning.

entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued November 06 at 12:12PM MST until November 08 at 5:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Yellowstone National Park and Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued November 06 at 12:12PM MST until November 08 at 5:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains West and Wind River Mountains East.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 06 at 12:12PM MST until November 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Absaroka Mountains. * WHEN...From late Monday night through late Tuesday night.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 06 at 12:12PM MST until November 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Salt River and Wyoming Ranges. * WHEN...From late Monday night through late Tuesday night.
